title: Mackenzie Crook's Funny New Show in Manchester
summary: A new comedy show called Small Prophets is coming to BBC Two. It was filmed in Greater Manchester, a place in England. The show stars Mackenzie Crook, who is an actor from The Office and Detectorists, and Sir Michael Palin. Mackenzie Crook also wrote and directed the show. The story is about a man named Michael who is looking for answers after his girlfriend disappears. His father, played by Sir Michael Palin, grows spirits in jars in his garden shed that can predict the future using a special recipe with rainwater and horse manure. The filming took seven weeks in Urmston and Stockport, and local people were very friendly to the cast and crew. The show will be on TV and BBC iPlayer.
